briefdescription.para: Constructor.
Destructor.

description.para: This methods are used to load the structure of your model.

briefdescription.para: Load the model of the robot from a iDynTree::Model class.

parameterdescription.para: the model to use in this class.

simplesect.para: true if all went ok, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Return true if the models for the robot have been correctly.

simplesect.para: True if the class has been correctly configure, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Set the used FrameVelocityRepresentation.

simplesect.para: FrameVelocityRepresentation

briefdescription.para: Get the used FrameVelocityRepresentation.
Get the number of internal degrees of freedom of the robot model used in the class.

detaileddescription.para: This return the internal degrees of freedom, because it does not include the eventual 6 degrees of freedom usually associated with the floating base.

simplesect.para: the number of internal degrees of freedom of the model.

briefdescription.para: Get a human readable description of a given internal degree of freedom of the robot.
Get a human readable description of all the internal degrees of freedom of the robot.

simplesect.para: a std::string containing the description of the internal degrees of freedom.

briefdescription.para: Get the number of links contained in the model.
Get the number of frames contained in the model.

simplesect.para: The number of frames is always greater than or equal to the number of links because every link has one link reference frame associated. An arbitrary number of additional reference frames can associated to a given link.

briefdescription.para: Get the name of the link considered as the floating base.

simplesect.para: the name of the base link.

briefdescription.para: Set the link that is used as the floating base link.

simplesect.para: true if all went well, false otherwise (for example if the link name was not found).

sectiondef.header: Methods to access the underlyng model for the robot
Methods to obtain the sparity patterns of Jacobians and Hessians

simplesect.para: Sparsity patterns does not depend on the particular joint configuration. The only requirement is that the model has been loaded before

memberdef.argsstring: (const iDynTree::FrameIndex refFrameIndex, const iDynTree::FrameIndex frameIndex, iDynTree::MatrixDynSize &outJacobianPattern) const
memberdef.name: getRelativeJacobianSparsityPattern

briefdescription.para: Returns the sparsity pattern of the relative Jacobian for the specified frames.

detaileddescription.para:
The resulting matrix has the same size of the free floating Jacobian (6 x #DoFs) It is filled with only 0 and 1 with the following meaning:
0: the element will always have 0 (for every robot configuration)
1: it exists a robot configuration such that the element have a value different from zero.
refFrameIndex
refence frame for the Jacobian
frameIndex
Jacobian frame
outJacobianPattern
the Jacobian sparsity pattern
true on success. False otherwise

memberdef.argsstring: (const iDynTree::FrameIndex refFrameIndex, const iDynTree::FrameIndex frameIndex, iDynTree::MatrixView< double > outJacobianPattern) const
memberdef.name: getRelativeJacobianSparsityPattern

briefdescription.para: Returns the sparsity pattern of the relative Jacobian for the specified frames (MatrixView implementation)

detaileddescription.para:
The resulting matrix must have the same size of the free floating Jacobian (6 x #DoFs) It is filled with only 0 and 1 with the following meaning:
0: the element will always have 0 (for every robot configuration)
1: it exists a robot configuration such that the element have a value different from zero.
refFrameIndex
refence frame for the Jacobian
frameIndex
Jacobian frame
outJacobianPattern
a MatrixView containing an already existing memory.
outJacobianPattern size must be 6 x #DoFs, it is not possible to resize a MatrixView element.
true on success. False otherwise

briefdescription.para: Returns the sparsity pattern of the free floating Jacobian for the specified frame.

detaileddescription.para:
The resulting matrix has the same size of the free floating Jacobian (6 x 6 + #DoFs) It is filled with only 0 and 1 with the following meaning:
0: the element will always have 0 (for every robot configuration)
1: it exists a robot configuration such that the element have a value different from zero.
frameIndex
Jacobian frame
outJacobianPattern
the Jacobian sparsity pattern
true on success. False otherwise

memberdef.argsstring: (const FrameIndex frameIndex, iDynTree::MatrixView< double > outJacobianPattern) const
memberdef.name: getFrameFreeFloatingJacobianSparsityPattern

briefdescription.para: Returns the sparsity pattern of the free floating Jacobian for the specified frame (MatrixView implementation).

detaileddescription.para:
The resulting matrix has the same size of the free floating Jacobian (6 x (6 + #DoFs)) It is filled with only 0 and 1 with the following meaning:
0: the element will always have 0 (for every robot configuration)
1: it exists a robot configuration such that the element have a value different from zero.
frameIndex
Jacobian frame
outJacobianPattern
the Jacobian sparsity pattern
outJacobianPattern size must be 6 x (#DoFs + 6), it is not possible to resize a MatrixView element.
true on success. False otherwise

sectiondef.header: Methods to submit the input data for dynamics computations.

briefdescription.para: Set the (internal) joint positions.

simplesect.para: This method sets only the joint positions, leaving all the other components of the state to their previous value.

parameterdescription.para: A vector of dimension this->model().getNrOfPosCoords() .

simplesect.para: true if all went well, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Set the (internal) joint positions.

detaileddescription.para: (Span implementation)

simplesect.para: This method sets only the joint positions, leaving all the other components of the state to their previous value.

parameterdescription.para: A vector of dimension this->model().getNrOfPosCoords() .

simplesect.para: true if all went well, false otherwise.

memberdef.argsstring: (const iDynTree::Transform &world_T_base, const iDynTree::VectorDynSize &s, const iDynTree::Twist &base_velocity, const iDynTree::VectorDynSize &s_dot, const iDynTree::Vector3 &world_gravity)
memberdef.name: setRobotState

briefdescription.para: Set the state for the robot (floating base)

parameterdescription.para: the homogeneous transformation that transforms position vectors expressed in the base reference frame in position frames expressed in the world reference frame (i.e. pos_world = world_T_base*pos_base .
a vector of getNrOfDegreesOfFreedom() joint positions (in rad)
The twist (linear/angular velocity) of the base, expressed with the convention specified by the used FrameVelocityConvention.
a vector of getNrOfDegreesOfFreedom() joint velocities (in rad/sec)
a 3d vector of the gravity acceleration vector, expressed in the world/inertial frame.

simplesect.para: true if all went well, false otherwise.

memberdef.argsstring: (iDynTree::MatrixView< const double > world_T_base, iDynTree::Span< const double > s, iDynTree::Span< const double > base_velocity, iDynTree::Span< const double > s_dot, iDynTree::Span< const double > world_gravity)
memberdef.name: setRobotState

briefdescription.para: Set the state for the robot (floating base) (Span and MatrixView implementation)

parameterdescription.para: the 4x4 homogeneous transformation that transforms position vectors expressed in the base reference frame in position frames expressed in the world reference frame (i.e. pos_world = world_T_base*pos_base).
a vector of getNrOfDegreesOfFreedom() joint positions (in rad)
The twist (linear/angular velocity) of the base, expressed with the convention specified by the used FrameVelocityConvention.
a vector of getNrOfDegreesOfFreedom() joint velocities (in rad/sec)
a 3d vector of the gravity acceleration vector, expressed in the world/inertial frame.

simplesect.para: the Span and the MatrixView objects should point an already existing memory. Memory allocation and resizing cannot be achieved with this kind of objects.
true if all went well, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Set the state for the robot (fixed base) Same as setRobotState, but with: world_T_base = iDynTree::Transform::Identity() base_velocity = iDynTree::Twist::Zero();.

memberdef.argsstring: (iDynTree::Span< const double > s, iDynTree::Span< const double > s_dot, iDynTree::Span< const double > world_gravity)
memberdef.name: setRobotState

briefdescription.para: Set the state for the robot (fixed base) Same as setRobotState, but with: world_T_base = iDynTree::Transform::Identity() base_velocity = iDynTree::Twist::Zero();.

simplesect.para: the Span objects should point an already existing memory. Memory allocation and resizing cannot be achieved with this kind of objects.
true if all went well, false otherwise.

memberdef.argsstring: (iDynTree::MatrixView< double > world_T_base, iDynTree::Span< double > s, iDynTree::Span< double > base_velocity, iDynTree::Span< double > s_dot, iDynTree::Span< double > world_gravity)
memberdef.name: getRobotState

memberdef.argsstring: (iDynTree::Span< double > s, iDynTree::Span< double > s_dot, iDynTree::Span< double > world_gravity)
memberdef.name: getRobotState

briefdescription.para: Access the robot state.
Get the n joint position of the model.

true if all went well, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Get the n joint velocity of the model.

true if all went well, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Get the n+6 velocity of the model.

detaileddescription.para: Obtained by stacking the output of getBaseTwist and of getJointVel.

briefdescription.para: Get the n+6 velocity of the model.

detaileddescription.para:
Obtained by stacking the output of getBaseTwist and of getJointVel.
the Span object should point an already existing memory. Memory allocation and resizing cannot be achieved with this kind of objects.

sectiondef.header: Methods to get transform information between frames in the model, given the current state.

briefdescription.para: Get the index corresponding to a given frame name.

simplesect.para: a integer greater than or equal to zero if the frame exist, a negative integer otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Get the frame name corresponding to a given frame index.
Return the transform where the frame is the frame specified by frameIndex, and the reference frame is the world one (world_H_frame).
Return the transform where the frame is the frame specified by frameIndex, and the reference frame is the world one (world_T_frame).

parameterdescription.para: a 4x4 matrix representing the homogeneous transformation that transforms position vectors expressed in the 'frame' reference frame in position frames expressed in the world reference frame (i.e. pos_world = world_T_frame * pos_frame).

simplesect.para: the MatrixView object should point an already existing memory. Memory allocation and resizing cannot be achieved with this kind of objects.
true if all went well, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Version of getWorldTransform where the frame is specified by name.

simplesect.para: For real time code use the method that takes an integer.

briefdescription.para: Version of getWorldTransform where the frame is specified by name (MatrixView and Span implementation).

simplesect.para: For real time code use the method that takes an integer.

briefdescription.para: Return the transforms as a homogeneous matrices where the frame is specified by name in the frameNames vector, and the reference frame is the world one (world_H_frame).
Return the transform where the frame is the frame specified by frameIndex, and the reference frame is the one specified by refFrameIndex (refFrame_H_frame).

memberdef.argsstring: (const iDynTree::FrameIndex refFrameIndex, const iDynTree::FrameIndex frameIndex, iDynTree::MatrixView< double > refFrame_H_frame)
memberdef.name: getRelativeTransform

briefdescription.para: Return the transform where the frame is the frame specified by frameIndex, and the reference frame is the one specified by refFrameIndex (refFrame_H_frame).

parameterdescription.para: a 4x4 matrix representing the homogeneous transformation that transforms position vectors expressed in the 'frame' reference frame in position frames expressed in the 'refFrame' reference frame (i.e. pos_refFrame = refFrame_T_frame * pos_frame).

simplesect.para: the Span and the MatrixView objects should point an already existing memory. Memory allocation and resizing cannot be achieved with this kind of objects.
true if all went well, false otherwise.

memberdef.argsstring: (const iDynTree::FrameIndex refFrameOriginIndex, const iDynTree::FrameIndex refFrameOrientationIndex, const iDynTree::FrameIndex frameOriginIndex, const iDynTree::FrameIndex frameOrientationIndex)
memberdef.name: getRelativeTransformExplicit

briefdescription.para: Return the transform between the frame with the origin of the frameOriginIndex and the orientation of frameOrientationIndex and the one with the origin of refFrameOriginIndex and the orientation of refFrameOrientationIndex .

detaileddescription.para: In symbols we return the (refFrameOrigin,refFrameOrientation)_H_(frameOrigin,frameORientation)
This is a variant of the getRelativeTransform in which the orientation and origin part of both side of the transform are explicited.

memberdef.argsstring: (const iDynTree::FrameIndex refFrameOriginIndex, const iDynTree::FrameIndex refFrameOrientationIndex, const iDynTree::FrameIndex frameOriginIndex, const iDynTree::FrameIndex frameOrientationIndex, iDynTree::MatrixView< double > refFrameOrigin_refFrameOrientation_H_frameOrigin_frameORientation)
memberdef.name: getRelativeTransformExplicit

briefdescription.para: Return the transform between the frame with the origin of the frameOriginIndex and the orientation of frameOrientationIndex and the one with the origin of refFrameOriginIndex and the orientation of refFrameOrientationIndex.

detaileddescription.para: (MatrixView and Span implementation)
In symbols we return the (refFrameOrigin,refFrameOrientation)_H_(frameOrigin,frameORientation)
This is a variant of the getRelativeTransform in which the orientation and origin part of both side of the transform are explicited.

briefdescription.para: Version of getRelativeTransform where the frames are specified by name.

simplesect.para: For real time code use the method that takes an integer.

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::string &refFrameName, const std::string &frameName, iDynTree::MatrixView< double > refFrame_H_frame)
memberdef.name: getRelativeTransform

briefdescription.para: Version of getRelativeTransform where the frames are specified by name (Span and MatrixView version).

simplesect.para: For real time code use the method that takes an integer.

memberdef.argsstring: (const iDynTree::FrameIndex refFrameIndex, const iDynTree::FrameIndex frameIndex, iDynTree::MatrixDynSize &outJacobian)
memberdef.name: getRelativeJacobian

briefdescription.para: Return the relative Jacobian between the two frames.

detaileddescription.para: The Jacobian maps the internal robot shape with the relative velocity of refFrame w.r.t. frame expressed depending on the velocity representation, i.e \[ v_{refFrame, frame} = J_{refFrame, frame}(s) \dot{s} \]

memberdef.argsstring: (const iDynTree::FrameIndex refFrameIndex, const iDynTree::FrameIndex frameIndex, iDynTree::MatrixView< double > outJacobian)
memberdef.name: getRelativeJacobian

briefdescription.para: Return the relative Jacobian between the two frames (MatrixView implementation).

detaileddescription.para: The Jacobian maps the internal robot shape with the relative velocity of refFrame w.r.t. frame expressed depending on the velocity representation, i.e \[ v_{refFrame, frame} = J_{refFrame, frame}(s) \dot{s} \]

simplesect.para: the MatrixView objects should point an already existing memory. Memory allocation and resizing cannot be achieved with this kind of objects.
true if all went well, false otherwise.

memberdef.argsstring: (const iDynTree::FrameIndex refFrameIndex, const iDynTree::FrameIndex frameIndex, const iDynTree::FrameIndex expressedOriginFrameIndex, const iDynTree::FrameIndex expressedOrientationFrameIndex, iDynTree::MatrixDynSize &outJacobian)
memberdef.name: getRelativeJacobianExplicit

briefdescription.para: Return the relative Jacobian between the two frames.

detaileddescription.para: The Jacobian maps the internal robot shape with the relative velocity of refFrame w.r.t. frame expressed in the specified frame, i.e \[ {}^{expressedOriginFrame, [expressedOrientationFrame]} \mathrm{v}_{refFrame, frame} = {}^{expressedOriginFrame, [expressedOrientationFrame]} J_{refFrame, frame}(s) \dot{s} \]

parameterdescription.para: reference frame
considered frame
frame whose origin is used to express the Jacobian
frame whose orientation is used to express the Jacobian

simplesect.para: true on success, false otherwise

memberdef.argsstring: (const iDynTree::FrameIndex refFrameIndex, const iDynTree::FrameIndex frameIndex, const iDynTree::FrameIndex expressedOriginFrameIndex, const iDynTree::FrameIndex expressedOrientationFrameIndex, iDynTree::MatrixView< double > outJacobian)
memberdef.name: getRelativeJacobianExplicit

briefdescription.para: Return the relative Jacobian between the two frames (MatrixView implementation)

detaileddescription.para: The Jacobian maps the internal robot shape with the relative velocity of refFrame w.r.t. frame expressed in the specified frame, i.e \[ {}^{expressedOriginFrame, [expressedOrientationFrame]} \mathrm{v}_{refFrame, frame} = {}^{expressedOriginFrame, [expressedOrientationFrame]} J_{refFrame, frame}(s) \dot{s} \]

parameterdescription.para: reference frame
considered frame
frame whose origin is used to express the Jacobian
frame whose orientation is used to express the Jacobian

simplesect.para: the MatrixView objects should point an already existing memory. Memory allocation and resizing cannot be achieved with this kind of objects.
true on success, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Get the bias acceleration (i.e.

detaileddescription.para: acceleration not due to robot acceleration) of the frame velocity.
This term is usually called $\dot{J} \nu$ or $\dot{J} \dot{q}$.

detaileddescription.para: acceleration not due to robot acceleration) of the frame velocity.

This term is usually called $\dot{J} \nu$ or $\dot{J} \dot{q}$.
the Span object should point an already existing memory. Memory allocation and resizing cannot be achieved with this kind of objects.
true on success, false otherwise

briefdescription.para: Get the bias acceleration (i.e.

detaileddescription.para: acceleration not due to robot acceleration) of the frame velocity.
This term is usually called $\dot{J} \nu$ or $\dot{J} \dot{q}$.

sectiondef.header: Methods to get quantities related to centroidal dynamics.

description.para: For a precise definition of the quantities computed by this methods, please check: S.
Traversaro, D. Pucci, F. Nori On the Base Frame Choice in Free-Floating Mechanical Systems and its Connection to Centroidal Dynamics https://traversaro.github.io/preprints/changebase.pdf

briefdescription.para: Return the center of mass position.

simplesect.para: the center of mass position, expressed in the world/inertial frame.

briefdescription.para: Return the center of mass position.

simplesect.para: the Span object should point an already existing memory. Memory allocation and resizing cannot be achieved with this kind of objects.
true on success, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Return the center of mass velocity, with respect to the world/inertial frame.

simplesect.para: This is the time derivative of the quantity returned by getCenterOfMassPosition .

briefdescription.para: Return the center of mass velocity, with respect to the world/inertial frame.

simplesect.para: This is the time derivative of the quantity returned by getCenterOfMassPosition.
the Span object should point an already existing memory. Memory allocation and resizing cannot be achieved with this kind of objects.
true on success, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Return the center of mass jacobian, i.e.

detaileddescription.para: the $3 \times (n+6)$ matrix such that: getCenterOfMassVelocity() == getCenterOfMassJacobian() * $ \nu$.

briefdescription.para: Return the center of mass jacobian, i.e.

detaileddescription.para: the $3 \times (n+6)$ matrix such that: getCenterOfMassVelocity() == getCenterOfMassJacobian() * $\nu $.

simplesect.para: the MatrixView object should point an already existing memory. Memory allocation and resizing cannot be achieved with this kind of objects.
true on success, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Return the center of mass bias acceleration.
Return the center of mass bias acceleration.

simplesect.para: the Span object should point an already existing memory. Memory allocation and resizing cannot be achieved with this kind of objects.
true on success, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Get the average velocity of the robot.

detaileddescription.para: The quantity is expressed in (B[A]), (A) or (B) depending on the FrameVelocityConvention used.

simplesect.para: the linear part of this twist correspond to the getCenterOfMassVelocity only if the FrameVelocityConvention is set to MIXED.
Implementation incomplete, please refrain to use until this warning has been removed.

briefdescription.para: Get the average velocity of the robot.

detaileddescription.para: (Span implementation) The quantity is expressed in (B[A]), (A) or (B) depending on the FrameVelocityConvention used.

simplesect.para: the linear part of this twist correspond to the getCenterOfMassVelocity only if the FrameVelocityConvention is set to MIXED.
the Span object should point an already existing memory. Memory allocation and resizing cannot be achieved with this kind of objects.
true on success, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Get the jacobian of the average velocity of the robot.

detaileddescription.para: The quantity is expressed in (B[A]), (A) or (B) depending on the FrameVelocityConvention used.

simplesect.para: the linear part of this jacobian correspond to the getCenterOfMassVelocity only if the FrameVelocityConvention is set to MIXED.
Implementation incomplete, please refrain to use until this warning has been removed.

briefdescription.para: Get the jacobian of the average velocity of the robot.

detaileddescription.para: (MatrixView implementation) The quantity is expressed in (B[A]), (A) or (B) depending on the FrameVelocityConvention used.

simplesect.para: the linear part of this jacobian correspond to the getCenterOfMassVelocity only if the FrameVelocityConvention is set to MIXED.
Implementation incomplete, please refrain to use until this warning has been removed.
the MatrixView object should point an already existing memory. Memory allocation and resizing cannot be achieved with this kind of objects.
true on success, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Get the centroidal average velocity of the robot.

detaileddescription.para: The quantity is the average velocity returned by getAverageVelocity, but computed in the center of mass and with the orientation of the FrameVelocityRepresentation used. It we indicate with G the center of mass, it is expressed in (G[A]) for the mixed and inertial representation, and in (G[B]) for the base body-fixed representation.

simplesect.para: the linear part of this twist correspond to the getCenterOfMassVelocity only if the FrameVelocityConvention is set to MIXED or INERTIAL.

briefdescription.para: Get the centroidal average velocity of the robot (Span version).

detaileddescription.para: The quantity is the average velocity returned by getAverageVelocity, but computed in the center of mass and with the orientation of the FrameVelocityRepresentation used. It we indicate with G the center of mass, it is expressed in (G[A]) for the mixed and inertial representation, and in (G[B]) for the base body-fixed representation.

simplesect.para: the linear part of this twist correspond to the getCenterOfMassVelocity only if the FrameVelocityConvention is set to MIXED or INERTIAL.
the Span object should point an already existing memory. Memory allocation and resizing cannot be achieved with this kind of objects.
true on success, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Get the jacobian of the centroidal average velocity of the robot.

detaileddescription.para: See the getCentroidalAverageVelocity method for more info on this.

briefdescription.para: Get the jacobian of the centroidal average velocity of the robot (MatrixView version).

detaileddescription.para:
See the getCentroidalAverageVelocity method for more info on this.
the Span object should point an already existing memory. Memory allocation and resizing cannot be achieved with this kind of objects.
true on success, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Get the linear and angular momentum of the robot.

detaileddescription.para: The quantity is expressed in (B[A]), (A) or (B) depending on the FrameVelocityConvention used.

simplesect.para: Implementation incomplete, please refrain to use until this warning has been removed.

briefdescription.para: Get the linear and angular momentum of the robot.

detaileddescription.para:
The quantity is expressed in (B[A]), (A) or (B) depending on the FrameVelocityConvention used.
spatialMomentum vector has to be a 6d-vector. The first 3 elements will contain the linear part, while the last 3 elements the angular part.
Implementation incomplete, please refrain to use until this warning has been removed.
the Span object should point an already existing memory. Memory allocation and resizing cannot be achieved with this kind of objects.
true on success, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Get the linear and angular momentum jacobian of the robot.

detaileddescription.para: The quantity is expressed in (B[A]), (A) or (B) depending on the FrameVelocityConvention used.

simplesect.para: Implementation incomplete, please refrain to use until this warning has been removed.

briefdescription.para: Get the linear and angular momentum jacobian of the robot (MatrixView implementation).

detaileddescription.para:
The quantity is expressed in (B[A]), (A) or (B) depending on the FrameVelocityConvention used.
Implementation incomplete, please refrain to use until this warning has been removed.
the Span object should point an already existing memory. Memory allocation and resizing cannot be achieved with this kind of objects.
true on success, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Get the centroidal (total) momentum of the robot.

detaileddescription.para: If G is the center of mass, this quantity is expressed in (G[A]), (G[A]) or (G[B]) depending on the FrameVelocityConvention used.

briefdescription.para: Get the centroidal (total) momentum of the robot.

detaileddescription.para: If G is the center of mass, this quantity is expressed in (G[A]), (G[A]) or (G[B]) depending on the FrameVelocityConvention used.

simplesect.para: the Span object should point an already existing memory. Memory allocation and resizing cannot be achieved with this kind of objects.
true on success, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Get the total centroidal momentum jacobian of the robot.

detaileddescription.para:
If G is the center of mass, this quantity is expressed in (G[A]), (G[A]) or (G[B]) depending on the FrameVelocityConvention used.
centroidalTotalMomentumJacobian
the (6) times (6+getNrOfDOFs()) output centroidal total momentum jacobian.
true if all went well, false otherwise.
If the chosen FrameVelocityRepresentation is MIXED_REPRESENTATION or INERTIAL_FIXED_REPRESENTATION, the function computes the Centroidal Momentum Matrix (CMM) introduced in https://doi.org/10.1109/IROS.2008.4650772 .

briefdescription.para: Get the total centroidal momentum jacobian of the robot.

detaileddescription.para:
If G is the center of mass, this quantity is expressed in (G[A]), (G[A]) or (G[B]) depending on the FrameVelocityConvention used (MatrixView implementation).
centroidalTotalMomentumJacobian
the (6) times (6+getNrOfDOFs()) output centroidal total momentum jacobian.
true if all went well, false otherwise.
If the chosen FrameVelocityRepresentation is MIXED_REPRESENTATION or INERTIAL_FIXED_REPRESENTATION, the function computes the Centroidal Momentum Matrix (CMM) introduced in https://doi.org/10.1109/IROS.2008.4650772 .
the MatrixView object should point an already existing memory. Memory allocation and resizing cannot be achieved with this kind of objects.

sectiondef.header: Methods to get quantities related to unconstrained free floating equation of motions.

description.para: This methods permits to compute several quantities related to free floating equation of methods.

Note that this equations needs to be coupled with a description of the interaction between the model and the enviroment (such as a contant model, a bilateral constraint on some links or by considering some external forces as inputs) to actually obtain a dynamical system description of the mechanical model evolution.

listitem.para: $n_{PC}$ is the value returned by Model::getNrOfPosCoords,
$n_{DOF}$ is the value returned by Model::getNrOfDOFs,
$n_{L}$ is the value returned by Model::getNrOfLinks,
$M(q) \in \mathbb{R}^{(6+n_{DOF}) \times (6+n_{DOF})}$ is the free floating mass matrix,
$G(q) \in \mathbb{R}^{6+n_{DOF}}$ is the vector of gravity generalized forces,
$\tau \in \mathbb{R}^6$ is the vector of torques applied on the joint of the multibody model,
$\mathcal{L}$ is the set of all the links contained in the multibody model,
$J_L \in \mathbb{R}^{6+n_{DOF}}$ is the free floating jacobian of link $L$ as obtained by KinDynComputations::getFrameFreeFloatingJacobian,
$\mathrm{f}_L^x$ is the 6D force/torque applied by the enviroment on link $L$.

description.para: The precise definition of each quantity (in particular the part related to the base) actually depends on the choice of FrameVelocityRepresentation, specified with the setFrameVelocityRepresentation method.

briefdescription.para: Get the free floating mass matrix of the system.

detaileddescription.para: This method computes $M(q) \in \mathbb{R}^{(6+n_{DOF}) \times (6+n_{DOF})}$.

The mass matrix depends on the joint positions, specified by the setRobotState methods. If the chosen FrameVelocityRepresentation is MIXED_REPRESENTATION or INERTIAL_FIXED_REPRESENTATION, the mass matrix depends also on the base orientation with respect to the inertial frame, that is also set by the setRobotState methods.
For more details on the structure of the free floating mass matrix, please check: S. Traversaro, A. Saccon Multibody Dynamics Notation http://repository.tue.nl/849895

parameterdescription.para: the (6+getNrOfDOFs()) times (6+getNrOfDOFs()) output mass matrix.

simplesect.para: true if all went well, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Get the free floating mass matrix of the system (MatrixView version).

detaileddescription.para: This method computes $M(q) \in \mathbb{R}^{(6+n_{DOF}) \times (6+n_{DOF})}$.

The mass matrix depends on the joint positions, specified by the setRobotState methods. If the chosen FrameVelocityRepresentation is MIXED_REPRESENTATION or INERTIAL_FIXED_REPRESENTATION, the mass matrix depends also on the base orientation with respect to the inertial frame, that is also set by the setRobotState methods.
For more details on the structure of the free floating mass matrix, please check: S. Traversaro, A. Saccon Multibody Dynamics Notation http://repository.tue.nl/849895

parameterdescription.para: the (6+getNrOfDOFs()) times (6+getNrOfDOFs()) output mass matrix.

simplesect.para: the MatrixView object should point an already existing memory. Memory allocation and resizing cannot be achieved with this kind of objects.
true if all went well, false otherwise.

memberdef.argsstring: (const Vector6 &baseAcc, const VectorDynSize &s_ddot, const LinkNetExternalWrenches &linkExtForces, FreeFloatingGeneralizedTorques &baseForceAndJointTorques)
memberdef.name: inverseDynamics

briefdescription.para: Compute the free floating inverse dynamics.

detaileddescription.para:
This method computes $M(q) \dot{
u} + C(q, 
u) 
u + G(q) - \sum_{L \in \mathcal{L}} J_L^T \mathrm{f}_L^x \in \mathbb{R}^{6+n_{DOF}}$.
The semantics of baseAcc, the base part of baseForceAndJointTorques and of the elements of linkExtWrenches depend of the chosen FrameVelocityRepresentation .
The state is the one given set by the setRobotState method.

parameterdescription.para: the acceleration of the base link
the accelerations of the joints
the external wrenches excerted by the environment on the model
the output generalized torques

simplesect.para: true if all went well, false otherwise

memberdef.argsstring: (iDynTree::Span< const double > baseAcc, iDynTree::Span< const double > s_ddot, const LinkNetExternalWrenches &linkExtForces, FreeFloatingGeneralizedTorques &baseForceAndJointTorques)
memberdef.name: inverseDynamics

briefdescription.para: Compute the free floating inverse dynamics (Span version).

detaileddescription.para:
This method computes $M(q) \dot{
u} + C(q, 
u) 
u + G(q) - \sum_{L \in \mathcal{L}} J_L^T \mathrm{f}_L^x \in \mathbb{R}^{6+n_{DOF}}$.
The semantics of baseAcc, the base part of baseForceAndJointTorques and of the elements of linkExtWrenches depend of the chosen FrameVelocityRepresentation .
The state is the one given set by the setRobotState method.

parameterdescription.para: the acceleration of the base link
the accelerations of the joints
the external wrenches excerted by the environment on the model
the output generalized torques

simplesect.para: the Span objects should point an already existing memory. Memory allocation and resizing cannot be achieved with this kind of objects.
true if all went well, false otherwise.

memberdef.argsstring: (const Vector6 &baseAcc, const VectorDynSize &s_ddot, const LinkNetExternalWrenches &linkExtForces, FreeFloatingGeneralizedTorques &baseForceAndJointTorques, LinkInternalWrenches &linkInternalWrenches)
memberdef.name: inverseDynamicsWithInternalJointForceTorques

briefdescription.para: This method is similar to inverseDynamics, but provides as an additional output the internal 6D force/torques (aka wrenches) excerted by the two links connected to each joint, in the linkInternalWrenches argument.

detaileddescription.para: The linkInternalWrenches is a container of $n_{L}$ (number of links) 6D Force/Torques, one associated to each link. In particular, if the link $L$ is the link with index $L$ the element linkInternalWrenches(i) contains, depending on the choice of FrameVelocityRepresentation:
Where if $C$ is a given frame, $ {}_{C} \mathrm{f}_{\lambda(L), L} $ is the 6D force/torque that the parent link $\lambda(L)$ excerts on its child $L$ expressed in frame $C$.

simplesect.para: Note that this definition strictly depends on the floating base specified in the KinDynComputations instances, as given a link $L$, its parent \lambda(L) depends on the choosen base link.

memberdef.argsstring: (iDynTree::Span< const double > baseAcc, iDynTree::Span< const double > s_ddot, const LinkNetExternalWrenches &linkExtForces, FreeFloatingGeneralizedTorques &baseForceAndJointTorques, LinkInternalWrenches &linkInternalWrenches)
memberdef.name: inverseDynamicsWithInternalJointForceTorques

briefdescription.para: Variant of inverseDynamicsWithInternalJointForceTorques that takes iDynTree::Span objects that point to already allocated memory as inputs.

detaileddescription.para: See inverseDynamicsWithInternalJointForceTorques for the description of the input and output parameters.

briefdescription.para: Compute the getNrOfDOFS()+6 vector of generalized bias (gravity+coriolis) forces.

detaileddescription.para: This method computes $C(q, \nu) \nu + G(q) \in \mathbb{R}^{6+n_{DOF}}$.
The semantics of the base part of generalizedBiasForces depend of the chosen FrameVelocityRepresentation .
The state is the one given set by the setRobotState method.

parameterdescription.para: the output generalized bias forces

simplesect.para: true if all went well, false otherwise

briefdescription.para: Compute the getNrOfDOFS()+6 vector of generalized bias (gravity+coriolis) forces.

detaileddescription.para: (Span version)
This method computes $C(q, \nu) \nu + G(q) \in \mathbb{R}^{6+n_{DOF}}$.
The semantics of the base part of generalizedBiasForces depend of the chosen FrameVelocityRepresentation .
The state is the one given set by the setRobotState method.

simplesect.para: generalizedBiasForces has to be a (6 + dofs)-d vector. The first 6 elements will contain the bias forces related to the system base, while the last dofs elements related to the joints.
the Span objects should point an already existing memory. Memory allocation and resizing cannot be achieved with this kind of objects.
true if all went well, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Compute the getNrOfDOFS()+6 vector of generalized gravity forces.

detaileddescription.para: This method computes $G(q) \in \mathbb{R}^{6+n_{DOF}}$.
The semantics of the base part of generalizedGravityForces depend of the chosen FrameVelocityRepresentation .
The state is the one given set by the setRobotState method.

parameterdescription.para: the output gravity generalized forces

simplesect.para: true if all went well, false otherwise

briefdescription.para: Compute the getNrOfDOFS()+6 vector of generalized gravity forces.

detaileddescription.para: This method computes $G(q) \in \mathbb{R}^{6+n_{DOF}}$.
The semantics of the base part of generalizedGravityForces depend of the chosen FrameVelocityRepresentation .
The state is the one given set by the setRobotState method.

simplesect.para: generalizedGravityForces has to be a (6 + dofs)-d vector. The first 6 elements will contain the bias forces related to the system base, while the last dofs elements related to the joints.
the Span objects should point an already existing memory. Memory allocation and resizing cannot be achieved with this kind of objects.
true if all went well, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Compute the getNrOfDOFS()+6 vector of generalized external forces.

detaileddescription.para: This method computes $ -\sum_{L \in \mathcal{L}} J_L^T \mathrm{f}_L^x \in \mathbb{R}^{6+n_{DOF}} $.

Note that this method returns the negated sum of the product of jacobian and the external force, consistently with how the generalized external forces are computed in the KinDynComputations::inverseDynamics method.
The semantics of the base part of generalizedExternalForces and of the elements of linkExtWrenches depend of the chosen FrameVelocityRepresentation .
The state is the one given set by the setRobotState method.

parameterdescription.para: the output external generalized forces

simplesect.para: true if all went well, false otherwise

briefdescription.para: Compute the free floating inverse dynamics as a linear function of inertial parameters.

detaileddescription.para: where $\phi \in \mathbb{R}^{10n_{L}}$ is the vector of inertial parameters returned by the Model::getInertialParameters .
The semantics of baseAcc, the base part (first six rows) of baseForceAndJointTorquesRegressor depend of the chosen FrameVelocityRepresentation .
The state is the one given set by the setRobotState method.

simplesect.para: iDynTree::InverseDynamicsInertialParametersRegressor for more info on the underlying algorithm.

parameterdescription.para: the acceleration of the base link
the accelerations of the joints
The (6+model.getNrOfDOFs() X 10*model.getNrOfLinks()) inverse dynamics regressor.

simplesect.para: true if all went well, false otherwise

briefdescription.para: High level stateful class wrapping several kinematics and dynamics algorithms.

detaileddescription.para: The kinematics dynamics computations class is an high level class stateful to access several algorithms related to kinematics and dynamics of free floating robot systems.

This class supports three possible convention to express the floating base information : the inertial, the body-fixed and the mixed convention. To get more info on this three conventions, check section II.C of On the Base Frame Choice in Free-Floating Mechanical Systems and its Connection to Centroidal Dynamics https://traversaro.github.io/preprints/changebase.pdf
